t: Psalm 80
A Prayer for Restoration
For the choir director: according to “The Lilies.” A testimony of Asaph. A psalm.
Listen,*pn Shepherd of Israel, who*ln leads Joseph like a flock; you*ln who sit enthroned between the cherubim, shine*ln
on Ephraim, Benjamin,*ln and Manasseh. Rally*ln your power and come to save us.
Restore*ln us, God; make*ln your face shine on us, so*ln that we may be saved.
Lord*spn God of Armies, how*ln long will you be angry with*ln your people’s prayers?
You*ln fed them the bread of tears and*ln gave them a full measure of*ln tears to drink.
You*ln put us at odds with our neighbors; our*ln enemies mock us.
Restore*ln us, God of Armies; make*ln your face shine on us, so that we may be saved.
You*pn dug up a vine from Egypt; you*ln drove out the nations and planted it.
You*ln cleared a place for it; it*ln took root and filled the land.
The*ln mountains were covered by its shade, and*ln the mighty cedars with its branches.
It*ln sent out sprouts toward the Sea and*ln shoots toward the River.
Why*pn have you broken down its walls so*ln that all who pass by pick its fruit?
Boars*ln from the forest tear at it and*ln creatures of the field feed on it.
Return,*ln God of Armies. Look*ln down from heaven and see; take*ln care of this vine,
the*ln root your right hand planted, the*ln son that you made strong for yourself.
It*ln was cut down and burned; they*ln perish at the rebuke of your countenance.
Let*ln your hand be with the man at your right hand, with*ln the son of man you*ln have made strong for yourself.
Then*ln we will not turn away from you; revive*ln us, and we will call on your name.
Restore*ln us, Lord,*s God of Armies; make*ln your face shine on us, so that we may be saved.
